newsitem.title: UK: UK to make statement Monday on utility regulation.
newsitem.headline: UK to make statement Monday on utility regulation.

text.p: Trade and Industry Secretary Margaret Beckett will make a statement to parliament on Monday on the new Labour government's approach to the regulation of utilities, government sources said on Friday.
They said the announcement will come in the form of a written answer to a parliamentary question, which appeared on Friday's parliamentary order paper.
Labour campaigned at the May 1 election for greater transparency and accountability in utility regulation, requiring relevant information to be publicly available.
It said the decision-making process should be broadened, possibly by introducing panels of non-executive directors to work alongside the industry regulator.
Labour said it would consider opening up the utilities to public hearings on prices, service standards and profits before price decisions were made.
